summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a letter motion from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Berman's chambers, requesting court approval of a proposed order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) in the criminal case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490. It indicates the government is seeking to drop the charges against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.

events.title: Government files motion for nolle prosequi
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a letter motion requesting the court approve an order of nolle prosequi (dismissal of charges) in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office is formally moving to dismiss the criminal charges against Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 Cr. 490) via a nolle prosequi order.
The motion was filed on August 19, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death in custody.
The correspondence is addressed to Judge Berman's chambers in the Southern District of New York.
Defense attorneys Martin Weinberg and Michael Miller are copied on the filing.
